Calories – 472
 1/2 cup instant oats
 1 cup full-fat milk
 1 banana, sliced
 2 tablespoons peanut butter
 A handful of raisins, soaked
 1 tablespoon honey

Bring the milk to a boil and add the instant oats.
 Simmer and cook until the oats become soft and the milk thickens.
 Remove from the flame and transfer to a bowl.
 Add honey and peanut butter. Stir well.
 Top it with banana slices and raisins.

Calories – 382
 whole bread slices
 2 tablespoons peanut butter
 1 tablespoon jam of your choice
Spread the peanut butter evenly on one bread slice.\n Spread the jam on the other slice of bread.\n Club them together and take a generous bite!

Calories – 293
 1 cup grated tofu
 1 tomato, chopped
 ½ medium-sized onion, chopped
 1 seeded green chili, chopped
 2 dollops of butter
 Salt to taste
 ¼ teaspoon pepper
 Cilantro for garnish

Add the butter to a pan.
 Toss in the onion and tomato.
 Cook for 5-6 minutes.
 Add in the grated tofu, green chilies, salt, and pepper.
 Stir and cook for 5 minutes.
 Cover and cook for 2 minutes more.
 Garnish with cilantro before serving.

Calories – 469
 2 slices of whole wheat bread
 ½ avocado, sliced
 2 tablespoons cottage cheese, mashed
 2 eggs
 A handful of pepita
 Salt to taste
 A pinch of pepper

Boil the eggs.
 Toast the bread and spread mashed cottage cheese.
 Add avocado slices on top.
 Finally, place the boiled eggs on top.
 Sprinkle salt, pepper, and pepita.

Calories – 529
 2 scoops vegan protein powder
 2 tablespoons almond powder
 1 tablespoon cashew powder
 2 cups soy milk
Toss all ingredients into a blender.\n Blend well and transfer it to two glasses.

Calories – 365
 2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar
 1 ½ teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil
 ⅛ teaspoon ground pepper
 Pinch of salt
 ⅔ cup lightly packed arugula
 1 teaspoon chopped fresh basil
 1 slice heirloom tomato, halved
 2 ounces burrata, halved
 2 slices ciabatta, toasted

Whisk vinegar, oil, pepper and salt together in a medium bowl.
 Add arugula and basil; toss to coat.
 Layer tomato, burrata and the arugula mixture on 1 slice of ciabatta.
 Drizzle with any remaining vinegar from the bowl; top with the other slice of ciabatta.
 Cut in half before serving.

Calories – 395
 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
 2 teaspoons rice vinegar
 1 teaspoon Sriracha or more to taste
 ¼ teaspoon garlic powder
 1 8-inch whole-wheat tortilla
 ¼ large avocado, sliced
 ½ cup thinly sliced and quartered cucumber
 ⅓ cup coarsely chopped arugula
 ¼ cup chopped red bell pepper

Stir mayonnaise, vinegar, Sriracha and garlic powder together in a small bowl.
 Lay tortilla on a clean work surface.
 Spread the mayonnaise mixture on the tortilla.
 Layer avocado slices on the lower third of the tortilla.
 Top the avocado with cucumber, arugula and bell pepper; roll up. Cut in half before serving.

Calories – 259
 ¾ cup whole-milk ricotta cheese
 ½ cup coarsely chopped fresh basil, plus more for garnish
 ¼ cup chopped fresh chives, plus more for garnish
 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil plus 1 1/2 teaspoons, divided
 1 teaspoon grated lemon zest
 1 tablespoon lemon juice

Combine ricotta, basil, chives, 2 tablespoons oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a food processor;
 process until smooth, about 1 minute.
 Spread the mixture evenly over toast slices.
 Top with tomatoes; drizzle with the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons oil.
 Garnish with additional basil and chives before serving, if desired.

Calories – 279
 3/4 cup nonfat plain yogurt
 1/2 cup 100% pure fruit juice
 1 1/2 cups (6 1/2 ounces) frozen fruit, such as blueberries, raspberries, pineapple or peaches
Puree yogurt with juice in a blender until smooth.\n With the motor running, add fruit through the hole in the lid and continue to puree until smooth.

Calories – 365
 1/2 Cup rolled oats
 1/2 cup peas
 1/2 inch Ginger
 2-3 Garlic cloves
 1-2 Green chillies
 Desi ghee (as per need)

1.Overnight soak the rolled oats.
 2.Boil the peas for a minute or two.
 3.In a chutney grinder, add boiled peas, ginger, garlic, green chilli, ajwain, hing and salt.
 4.Grind everything into a paste.
 5.On medium to low flame, cook each side well till it turns golden brown in colour.
 6.Add some ghee on the edges if needed.

Calories – 295
 1 Cup uncooked quinoa
 2 cups water
 1/2 cup red onion, sliced3 cups cucumber (diced)
 1 1/2 cup purple cabbage
 1/2 cup avocado (ripened and diced)

Boil the quinoa in water according to package directions.
 This should take about 12-15 minutes, and all water should be absorbed.
 Remove it from the heat, fluff with a fork and allow it to cool.
 Whisk together the dressing in a small bowl and set aside.

Calories – 259
 2 tablespoons olive oil
 1 cup diced onion (1/2 large onion)
 3/4 cup diced carrots (1 large carrot)
 1 tablespoon minced garlic (3 cloves)
 1 teaspoon ground cumin

Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or deep pot over medium heat,\n and then add the onions and carrot.\n Cook, stirring often, until they have softened slightly and smell sweet, about 5 minutes.
In a bowl, combine all the ingredients for the vinaigrette.\n Whisk well and season to taste.\n Arrange all the ingredients for the salad in a bowl.
